question: What is the name of the French Overseas Territory that is located between two sovereign countries such as "Antigua and Barbuda" and "Dominica"?
explanation: Guadeloupe is an archipelago forming an overseas region of France located where the northeastern Caribbean Sea meets the western Atlantic Ocean. This archipelago forms part of the Leeward Islands of the Lesser Antilles archipelago. Guadeloupe is located between two countries in which Antigua and Barbuda lie to the north and Dominica lies to the south. The British Overseas Territory of Montserrat is located to the north of Guadeloupe.
